official-title.#text: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may jointly designate, the 29th annual District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run (in this resolution referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate

term.#tail: ) may be run through the Capitol Grounds to carry the Special Olympics torch to honor local Special Olympics athletes.

text.#text: On October 3, 2014, or on such other date as the

header.#text: Authorization of use of Capitol Grounds for D.C. Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take such actions as may be necessary to carry out the event.
may prescribe conditions for physical preparations for the event.
shall provide for enforcement of the restrictions contained in

, United States Code, concerning sales, advertisements, displays, and solicitations on the Capitol Grounds, as well as other restrictions applicable to the Capitol Grounds, in connection with the event.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives July 25, 2014.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HCON 103 EH: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
